context_bundle.summary: Clinical psychology patterns: DSM-5 diagnostic framework, transdiagnostic factors (rumination, avoidance, negative affect), evidence-based treatments (CBT, DBT, ACT, exposure), therapeutic alliance, treatment matching.

onboarding.quick_start: Diagnosis = pattern recognition + functional impairment. CBT for anxiety/depression. DBT for emotion dysregulation. Exposure for phobias/OCD. Alliance predicts outcome across modalities.
common_patterns: Anxiety disorders: Avoidance maintains fear, exposure is gold standard, safety behaviors prevent learning
Depression: Behavioral activation, cognitive restructuring, rumination reduction
Transdiagnostic: Negative affect, avoidance, rumination cut across disorders - unified protocols
Therapeutic factors: Alliance (d=.57), empathy, goal consensus, positive regard
known_errors: Treating symptoms not function - same behavior different function needs different intervention
Ignoring therapeutic alliance - predicts more variance than specific technique
Rigid protocol adherence - flexibility within fidelity improves outcomes
Pathologizing normal distress - not all suffering is disorder
